title: Requires medical directors at state correctional facilities to be trained or certified in addiction medicine
summary: Requires medical directors at state correctional facilities to be trained or certified in addiction medicine.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1449

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 10, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. ORTIZ -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Correction

       AN ACT to amend the correction law, in relation to the qualifications of
         medical directors at state correctional facilities

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The correction law is amended by adding a new section 624
    2  to read as follows:
    3    S 624.  MEDICAL  DIRECTOR;  PSYCHIATRIC  CERTIFICATION  AND  TRAINING.
    4  WITHIN  ONE  HUNDRED  EIGHTY  DAYS  OF  RECEIVING  AN APPOINTMENT AS THE
    5  MEDICAL DIRECTOR OF A STATE CORRECTIONAL FACILITY, SUCH MEDICAL DIRECTOR
    6  SHALL BE TRAINED AND/OR CERTIFIED IN ADDICTION MEDICINE IN  SUCH  A  WAY
    7  THAT MEETS ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS:
    8    1.  THE  MEDICAL  DIRECTOR HOLDS A SUBSPECIALTY BOARD CERTIFICATION IN
    9  ADDICTION PSYCHIATRY FROM THE AMERICAN BOARD OF MEDICAL SPECIALITIES;
   10    2. THE MEDICAL DIRECTOR HOLDS  AN  ADDICTION  CERTIFICATION  FROM  THE
   11  AMERICAN SOCIETY OF ADDICTION MEDICINE;
   12    3.  THE  MEDICAL  DIRECTOR HOLDS A SUBSPECIALTY BOARD CERTIFICATION IN
   13  ADDICTION MEDICINE FROM THE AMERICAN OSTEOPATHIC ASSOCIATION; AND
   14    4. THE MEDICAL DIRECTOR HAS COMPLETED NOT LESS  THAN  EIGHT  HOURS  OF
   15  TRAINING WITH RESPECT TO THE TREATMENT AND MANAGEMENT OF OPIOID-ADDICTED
   16  PATIENTS.  SUCH  TRAINING  MAY BE PROVIDED THROUGH CLASSROOM SITUATIONS,
   17  SEMINARS AT PROFESSIONAL SOCIETY MEETINGS, ELECTRONIC COMMUNICATIONS, OR
   18  OTHERWISE. THE TRAINING SHALL BE SPONSORED BY ANY ORGANIZATION THAT  THE
   19  DEPARTMENT OF MENTAL HYGIENE DETERMINES TO BE APPROPRIATE.
   20    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.


        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03925-01-1
